title: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: While writing SWT code, I type the following: button.dispose. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED, intWidgetdispose(), voidWidget. I then type "(" because the line I was typing was supposed to be: button.dispose(); But as soon as I type the "(", then automatic code assist seems to insert whatever is selected.
OB: When typing "button.dispose", automatic code assist inserts the wrong suggestion from the list without me explicitly selecting it.
EB: Automatic code assist should notice that I have typed a "(" and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". It should either prioritize case-sensitive suggestions or have a mechanism to determine the intended suggestion based on context.
SR:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Open the SWT code editor. 
2. Start typing "button.dispose" without looking at the code assist list. 
3. After typing ".dispose", type "(" immediately. 

Expected behavior: 
Automatic code assist should suggest "dispose()" instead of "DISPOSED" based on the context of the opening parenthesis.
